channel.title: Ubuntu Wireless Help
channel.description: Hello! I am currently about to install Ubuntu 7.04 onto my laptop, but I am having some problems connecting to my wireless network, as it simply cannot find it. I have a Wireless - N RangeMax Next wireless router model wnr834m netgear router. I am not sure about the laptops wireless card, but it is built in and can get 54.0 mbps from the router, so its a b/g card i think?? If anyone can help me it would be very much appreciated as my Linksys Wireless B router is now junky and I don't want to have to use 2 routers! Thanks Justis EDIT It is now working, I found out linux is quite picky with capitalization [not Netgear but NETGEAR to connect].

item.title: Ubuntu Wireless Help
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Hello!
I am currently about to install Ubuntu 7.04 onto my laptop, but I am having some problems connecting to my wireless network, as it simply cannot find it.
I have a Wireless - N RangeMax Next wireless router model wnr834m netgear router.
I am not sure about the laptops wireless card, but it is built in and can get 54.0 mbps from the router, so its a b/g card i think??
If anyone can help me it would be very much appreciated as my Linksys Wireless B router is now junky and I donâ€™t want to have to use 2 routers!
Thanks
Justis
EDIT
It is now working, I found out linux is quite picky with capitalization [not Netgear but NETGEAR to connect].

Read full topic
